films.name: Minari
films.about: A Korean American family moves to an Arkansas farm in search of its own American dream. Amidst the challenges of new life in the strange and rugged Ozarks, they discover the undeniable resilience of family and what really makes a home.
films.cast/crew: Steven Yeun, Yeri Han, Alan Kim, Noel Kate Cho, and Yuh-Jung Youn

films.name: A Song from the Dark
films.about: After the mysterious death of her husband, a woman hires a reluctant spirit hunter to expel an evil spirit tormenting her family. Unknown to the spirit hunter, the family has a dark secret that they have sworn to keep hidden at all cost.
films.cast/crew: Ryan Spong, Wale Ojo, Dean Kilbey, Lola Wayne, Isioma Williams, Vanessa Vanderpuye, and Kane Surry

films.name: Rye Lane
films.about: Two youngsters reeling from bad breakups connect over an eventful day in South London.
films.cast/crew: David Jonsson, Vivian Oparah, Poppy Allen-Quarmby, Charlie Knight, Simon Manyonda

films.name: Summer Of Violence
films.about: It tells the story of Naomi, who turns down law school to pursue poetry. She struggles to survive in 1993 Denver, after being cut off during a period of violent crime in the city known as the Summer of Violence.
films.cast/crew: Kasey Inez, Jahking Guillory, Damon Gupton, Madhulika Krishnan, Pedro Correa, and Shon Wilson

films.name: Polite Society
films.about: Ria Khan believes she must save her older sister Lena from her impending marriage. After enlisting her friends' help, she attempts to pull off the most ambitious of all wedding heists in the name of independence and sisterhood.
films.cast/crew: Priya Kansara, Ritu Arya, Renu Brindle, Rekha John-Cheriyan, Seraphina Beh, and Ella Bruccoleri

films.name: Sthal (A Match)
films.about: It explores the tradition of arranged marriage in rural India, where a girl's marriage overshadows the very sustenance of life. Narrated from the perspective of a young girl, Savita, it highlights the patriarchy rooted in society.
films.cast/crew: Nandini Chikte, Taranath Khiratkar, Sangita Sonekar, Suyog Dhawas, Sandip Somalkar, and Sandip Parkhi
